comment: Terrible quizzes, tons of lectures to watch, and long chapters. Lockdown browser required. Do not take.

Heavy lectures but then he quizzes and tests over something entirely different, book more helpful than lecture, makes his own tests/quizzes but refuses to correct serious grammatical errors in questions, had to open exams and quizzes for 2 attempts because almost everyone was failing. class average on exam 1 was an F, says a lot about his teaching.

Prof Roy was terrible. His lectures were boring and he did not seem to care about his students. Ask him a question during the review days and he will make them seem dummy proof. He goes through a question in about 20-40 seconds during review days and for most business majors, this is your first econ class. STAND CLEAR
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Roy is one of the best professors Ive had. His tests are VERY hard but if you put in the time and effort you will get a good grade. He cares about teaching the students and does not take any short cuts so be prepared for a hard class! No homework or attendance, but if you skip class you will be very far behind. Go to class!!!!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: this guy is hilarious. I will be taking him in future econ classes. highly recommend

Took him for Macro online over the summer and it was the best decision ever!! 12 quizzes, 1 midterm, and 1 final. He drops 2 of the quizzes. All open note and most questions can be found online. Honestly the best option to get an easy easy A. TAKE HIM!!
Passionate about Econ and bought pizza for us when did well
Really funny, explains and connects definitions. And sets you up for a good grade. His examples are related to the real world and makes learning easy to understand

Prof Roy only grades by 3 tests which are all multiple choice. Most of the content was a repeat for me from previous ECON, so attending all lectures gave me an easy A. Attendance is not mandatory and even though he recommends the book, didn't open it all semester. Test reviews before every test are EXTREMELY helpful and he answers all questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Not really that great of a teacher. He does give study guides but has nothing to do with the test or even relates to what is on the test. His test were incrediblley hard but he did curve them and people would end up with a 71 even with the curve. That should show how hard the class was. He made the class harder than it should have been. STAY AWAY!

Dr. Roy is fair. His first test is impossibly hard. Best score before massive curve was a 71. Second test was simple after seeing his grading method. The material is tough in itself, don't blame the professor for that - Definitely passable if you pay attention in class and do a few examples at home.

Don't take his class if you're looking for an easy A. He expects you to have studied before the class and especially the tests. He gives you practice tests for all the exams. If you struggle in this subject don't take his class. You're best bet of getting a good grade is to read the book, come to class, and know everything about the practice tests.

AWFUL. He should not be teaching. He has his doctorate and he acts like he is above helping the "less informed." He thinks he is hilarious but he says the corniest things. He literally insulted me in front of the class about a question I asked. After that everybody else was affair to ask a question. Always rolling his eyes and sighing at people.
